snippet: Herbert E. Nass, a longtime customer at the Palm in Manhattan, fears that his caricature, which hangs near his favorite booth, may be painted over or obliterated during a renovation.
abstract: Grace Notes column; legendary Manhattan steakhouse The Palm, once a gathering place for the rich and influential, will receive its first major renovation since opening its doors in 1926; regulars worry that so-called facelift will obliterate some of restaurant's most charming features.
lead_paragraph: Herbert E. Nass, a longtime customer at the Palm in Manhattan, fears that his caricature, which hangs near his favorite booth, may be painted over or obliterated during a renovation.

headline.print_headline: A Regular Worries That the Palm’s Face-Lift Could Cause Wrinkles
headline.main: A Regular Worries That the Palm’s Face-Lift Could Cause Wrinkles
